author: .vbuterin

author: etan_status
content: 8 Feb 1pm or 2pm UTC would work best for me, but could also do today / tomorrow (UTC+1 based)

author: roberto.bayardo
content: <@881905303011086387> is deprecating non-chainID legacy txs in 6404 a reasonable possibility? Would be nice to avoid the tx_subtype wart.

author: etan_status
content: Would be nice, indeed. There was an attempt here, that I mentioned in the discussions-to magicians thread: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3788

author: etan_status
content: Also tried several other approaches. See rationale section in EIP

author: roberto.bayardo
content: I see there that <@301186049323958275> points out a legitimate use case for replayable txs that I guess still has no alternative (deterministic contract deploys across chains).

author: etan_status
content: Note that replayability is fine, per se. It is only for `LegacyTransaction` there is an ambiguity between `chain_id = 0` and `chain_id = nil`. I'm not sure if both or those are used.

author: roberto.bayardo
content: This quote in 3788 is confusing: "Per EIP-155 a transaction with a chainId = 0 is considered to be a valid transaction. "   Because when I read EIP-155 it says no such thing.  So yeah I am also confused whether chain_id=0 (for EIP-155 txs) is allowed.

author: etan_status
content: Yeah, it should be discussed whether `v` = `{35,36}` (`chain_id = 0`) is allowed in EIP-155. I don't have the tools available to scan Mainnet/Goerli/Sepolia/Gnosis to see whether this value was ever used. `v` = `{27,28}` (`chain_id = nil`) is just the standard legacy transaction without replay protection. If `v` = `{35,36}` can be banned, the `tx_subtype` could be deleted. There is no other use for `tx_subtype`.

author: roberto.bayardo
content: looks like sender validation would fail in geth at least for v=35/36 since it checks for matching chain id.

author: roberto.bayardo
content: ...and if it was ever allowed in the past seems like it's still worth forbidding in the future, since you can just submit legacy / v=26/27 if you need replayability

author: roberto.bayardo
content: <@881905303011086387> one more Q: do we really need IndexedTransaction (to store the tx hash) if we have IndexedReceipt?  The latter can be used to prove tx inclusion via tx hash.  So what does having it in the transactions subtree buy us?

author: etan_status
content:
Is that check only for the v=35/36 transactions (EIP-155 legacy tx), or is `chain_id=0` also filtered out in Geth for post-EIP2930 transactions?
Overall, I would love to delete `tx_subtype` (by banning `v = {35,36}`), but EIP-3788 kinda suggests that `{35,36}` at least has some history, and I'd like to know for sure that this is removable.
Note that post-EIP2930 transactions don 't use `v` value in signature anymore, but instead just use `y_parity`.
